entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 10:56AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas dense fog may linger into early afternoon... Areas of dense fog remain over portions of northeast Ohio late this morning, but visibility will steadily improve through early afternoon as the fog dissipates. Dense fog will linger the longest in valleys and low lying areas, where visibility may be reduced to one quarter mile at times through midday.

entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG WILL LINGER THROUGH NOON... Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches in the lower elevations; 5 to 8 inches on Casper Mountain. * WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range, Natrona County Lower Elevations, and Casper Mountain.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 03 at 3:54AM MDT until November 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Rock Springs and Green River, Flaming Gorge, and East Sweetwater County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Sweetwater County; Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 03 at 3:54AM MDT until November 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow likely. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 14 inches possible over the south. Over the north including Mammoth 3 to 6 inches are possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph in the mountains.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yellowstone National Park

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 03 at 3:54AM MDT until November 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Periods of moderate to heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches possible west, and 3 to 6 inches over the eastern portions of the range. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph on ridge tops and open areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 03 at 3:54AM MDT until November 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow likely. Preliminary total snow accumulations in the mountains of 18 to 24 inches, while 5 to 10 in the lower elevations. Very windy in the mountains could result in whiteout conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 03 at 3:54AM MDT until November 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow likely. entry.cap:areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley
